title: Ending Procurement and Forced Use of Paper Straws

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to stop buying and using paper straws, which are seen as ineffective and potentially harmful. It calls for a national strategy to end policies against plastic straws and promote their use instead.
potential_concerns: Ending the use of paper straws may increase costs for small business owners who rely on environmentally friendly products to meet local regulations or consumer demand.
Reversing bans on plastic straws could negatively impact environmental justice communities that face disproportionate exposure to plastic pollution and related health hazards.
Federal employees operating agency facilities might face challenges managing transitions away from paper straws while addressing diverse stakeholder preferences.
The national strategy promoting plastic straws could inadvertently increase plastic waste, undermining broader environmental sustainability goals.
